page.title: 09Weston Shelf.
page.content: This survey area is just south of the mouth of the River Itchen and apart from a small area of coastline in the north-east corner of the survey square is all{inland water. } There are mudflats stretching from the shoreline, taking up about one half of the area. On the small area of coastal land is grass.It is a coastal{Recreation Area used by local families for walks,ball games and kite-flying.There are a few wild shrubs. There is a pathway along the shore from Weston Shore to Woolston near the {sailing club.}The beach area is of shingle and gravel-no sand.The area is not suitable for bathing,being too dirty. When the tide is out the mudflats smell.When the tide is in fishermen using rod and line, fish from the shore.
